business.headline: Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

This key agreement in UK trade deal will hugely benefit Indian firms, workersOne of the key parts of the India-UK trade deal is the introduction of the Double Contribution Convention (DCC), which is expected to help Indian professionals working in the UK by reducing their social security burden.

Filing ITR under old regime? Claim these 5 home loan tax benefits If you are sticking to the old tax regime this year, make sure you don't miss out on the big tax savings your home loan can offer. Here are five home loan benefits you must know for your ITR.

Who has to file ITR by when? All 2025 deadlines explainedFiling your ITR on time can save you from paying extra penalties. But not everyone has the same deadline this year. Here's a quick look at who must file by when for the 2025 cycle.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points: Why stock markets are in the red today The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex fell 624.64 points to 81,559.53 by 10:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 215.85 points to 24,846.25.

entertainment.headline: After harassment claims, Tanushree Dutta says she is leading quiet, spiritual lifeActor Tanushree Dutta stated that she was overwhelmed with constant media requests for interviews. She had recently claimed about facing life threat at her home in Mumbai.

Shruti Haasan promises a brave new world as father Kamal Haasan joins Rajya SabhaActor Kamal Haasan was sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP in Delhi. His actor-daughter Shruti Haasan dedicated an emotional post to him, highlighting the personal side of his political milestone.

Did you know that Saiyaara's Ahaan Panday is a Blackpink fan?Ahaan Panday astonished fans with an unexpected K-pop revelation, naming BLACKPINK's Lisa as his favourite idol. The admission sent Indian K-pop enthusiasts into a frenzy. Read more here.
Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda attend event in New York, singer Tesher joinsSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda attended an event together in New York. Pictures of them partying have emerged online.

Mohit Suri's Saiyaara captures Gen Z's raw and real love storyMohit Suri's Saiyaara has become a cultural hit among Gen Z for its raw portrayal of young love. The film's focus on mental health and emotional depth sparks new conversations about romance and relationships.

Ed Sheeran loved Arijit's voice so much, he released a new version of SapphireSinger Ed Sheeran has expressed high praise for Arijit Singh in a detailed post, saying he loves his voice. Both versions of 'Sapphire', which feature intricate South Asian percussion, were produced by Ilya Salmanzadeh, Johnny McDaid, and Savan Kotecha.

Karan Johar on being isolated as a kid for being too feminine: Wasn't boy enoughKaran Johar opened up about his childhood struggles with being labelled as feminine. He recalled his challenges as a child in seeking acceptance and belonging from his peers.

S Line could just be the most genius K-Drama of 2025. Because sex and secrets!Lee Soo-hyuk's 'S Line' blends a provocative premise, sharp social commentary, and gripping mystery. In this week's K-Fix we will discuss why it is 2025's boldest K-drama yet.

Karan Johar regrets making OK Jaanu, says felt uncertain but ignored instinctsKaran Johar expressed regret over making 'OK Jaanu', admitting he ignored his instincts despite feeling uncertain about the remake. The film did not meet expectations, and Johar acknowledges this as a mistake he often makes, even as he prepares for his next production, 'Dhadak 2'.

All eyes on Bigg Boss 19 as makers officially begin countdown with bold logo'Bigg Boss 19' is all set to premiere this August on JioHotstar. Ahead of its premiere, the makers shared an exciting promo on July 23, to build the intrigue.

Is Saiyaara's title track copied from Jubin Nautiyal and One Direction?Fans believe that Saiyaara's title track is copied from songs by One Direction and Jubin Nautiyal. This follows speculation that the movie itself is a remake of the Korean film 'A Moment to Remember'.

Ayya The Lion of Tamil Nadu: PMK founder Ramadoss's biopic announced with posterDirector Cheran to helm the biopic 'Ayya - The Lion of Tamil Nadu', with Aari Arujunan in the lead role. The film will explore the life of PMK founder Ramadoss and the Vanniyar reservation agitation.

War 2 trailer sparks meme fest over bizarre speedboat scene on F1 trackThe trailer of 'War 2' has sparked a wave of amusement and criticism online, especially for a surreal scene featuring a speedboat on a Formula 1 racetrack. The highly-anticipated trailer was released on July 25.

Matt Shakman, Vanessa Kirby, Pedro Pascal on rebooting Fantastic FourMarvel Studios introduces The Fantastic Four: First Steps, a fresh take on the iconic superhero family set in an alternate 1960s universe. The film combines cosmic adventure with heartfelt themes of parenthood and vulnerability.

War 2 trailer review: Style, swag and jarring bikini moment in Hrithik-Jr NTR's film'War 2' looks unbelievably stylish, and packed with swag. But is that all? Are we getting another spy film that glorifies that one saviour of the country? And more importantly, what is an Indian Air Force officer doing in a bikini?

Udaipur Files to release on August 8 after Supreme Court clearanceThe film 'Udaipur Files' is set for release on August 8, 2025 post Supreme Court direction. The decision comes after censor and legal challenges caused a delay to its original release date. Starring Vijay Raaz, it aims to reach a global audience.

War 2 trailer X reaction: Fans praise Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara's action festThe 'War 2' trailer starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani has earned praise online. Fans are excited for the Hrithik-Jr NTR showdown and Kiara's action-packed role.

Varun Dhawan to Arjun Kapoor, celebs mourn WWE icon Hulk Hogan's deathWWE star Hulk Hogan died aged 71 after suffering a cardiac arrest at his home in Florida. Actors Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor and others paid tribute to the wrestling icon.

general news.headline: From 'India Out' to most trusted friend: PM, Maldives' Muizzu recalibrate tiesIndia extended a Rs 4,850 crore credit line to the Maldives as PM Modi reaffirmed strong bilateral ties, calling the friendship "older than history and as deep as the ocean."

Students raised alarm before Rajasthan school roof caved in: Teachers scolded usThe teachers were allegedly having breakfast outside the area where the roof of the school in Rajasthan collapsed — the same place where students had gathered for the morning assembly. When pebbles began to fall inside, the children alerted the teachers. However, according to a student, the teachers scolded them and asked them to return to class.

Stop fuelling Russia's aggression: US warns China at UN over Ukraine warThe US and China clashed at the UN as Washington accused Beijing of helping Russia's war in Ukraine. China denied the claim and called for peace talks instead.

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

How an India-US spy mission lost a nuclear device in the HimalayasAfter China's first atomic test, the US and India, as part of a covert operation, tried to place a nuclear-powered listening device at 25,000 feet in the Himalayas near the Nanda Devi peak. A blizzard forced the CIA-IB team to leave the device on the route. A recovery mission, and several search operations, failed to locate the device.

4th Test: Wheels come off for India in Manchester as Joe Root rewrites recordsEngland vs India, 4th Test: India conceded 319 runs as England seized control on Day 3 in Manchester. Joe Root scored a commanding 150, climbing to second place on the all-time list of Test run-scorers and leading what could be a series-defining batting charge for the hosts.

Ties strong enough: India shrugs off anti-Modi post by Muizzu's brother-in-lawIndia's Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said that rather than looking back, India prefers to focus on the future, dismissing the now-deleted critical post about PM Modi by Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu's brother-in-law as mere 'passing remarks.'

Why CAG is alarmed by Maharashtra's off-Budget borrowingsThe statutory auditor, in its report, cautioned that continuing with the trend could worsen the debt/GSDP ratio, reducing the government's fiscal flexibility
Prada turns devil again? Now, it's juttis after KolhapurisJutti-inspired much? Prada's 'Antiqued Leather Pumps' spark another row.

Narendra Modi not a big problem: Rahul Gandhi says PM is all show, no substanceRahul Gandhi claimed that after meeting PM Modi two to three times and "sitting with him in the same room," he had figured that the Prime Minister was never a "big problem." He then went on to say, "Dum nahin hai" (He doesn't have guts).

Bengaluru stadium, set to host Women's World Cup matches, deemed unsafe: ReportThe M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been declared unsafe for large-scale events following a judicial commission report. The iconic venue is slated to host crucial matches in the upcoming Women's World Cup, scheduled for September-October.

Thailand declares martial law along Cambodia border; PM's 'state of war' warningThailand's acting Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai said on Friday that the ongoing conflict between the two nations may escalate into a full-fledged war soon.

Special investigation: Shady madrasas mushrooming along Indo-Nepal borderThe investigation reveals how madrasas in Bihar and neighbouring Nepal are accepting money routed through illegal hawala channels — mostly from Gulf countries — and, in many instances, are reportedly involved in teaching content that promotes extremist ideologies.
Caught on CCTV: Sick elderly woman dumped by family on roadside in Ayodhya, diesCCTV footage showed a man, most likely an e-rickshaw driver, helping two women drop the elderly woman by the roadside.

3 men rape Odisha girl, try to bury her alive after finding out she's pregnantThe three accused raped the girl for months on several occasions and tried to bury her alive when they found out that she was five-months pregnant.

Teen gang targeting Indians on attack spree in Dublin?A 40-year-old Indian man was brutally attacked and stripped by a gang of teenagers in Dublin's Tallaght suburb, in what Irish police are probing as a possible hate crime. Eyewitness Jennifer Murray said at least four Indian-origin individuals have been attacked in the last week by minors in Ireland. Is a gang on an attack spree?

After harassment claims, Tanushree Dutta says she is leading quiet, spiritual lifeActor Tanushree Dutta stated that she was overwhelmed with constant media requests for interviews. She had recently claimed about facing life threat at her home in Mumbai.

How India's strategic assets lie exposed, vulnerable to harmWith detailed imagery of military bases, nuclear plants, border posts and more easily accessible to Open Source Intelligence, how dangerous is this for national security?

Unbearable pain: Paralysed Indore teacher seeks President's nod for euthanasiaKumari Chandrakanta Jethani  who teaches daily while confined to a wheelchair, is battling severe physical ailments. Teaching for 7 to 8 hours a day in such a condition has become extremely painful for her

Divorced Thai man gives up food, water; dies after surviving on beer for a monthAccording to a Daily Star report, the deceased, Thaweesak Namwongsa, even stopped drinking water and proper food, leading to a quick deterioration of his health.

Thief hangs from moving train in Bihar, jumps after stealing phone. Video goes viralAfter snatching a mobile phone, a thief clung to the footboard of a moving train and later jumped off while it was crossing a bridge.

Delhi boy, 14, sexually assaulted, stabbed 24 times for 'snitching' on gangTen people involved in the crime that was allegedly committed on the intervening night of June 29-30, including the main accused, Krishna alias Bhola, 19, are in police custody.
Why small-town students are no longer putting all their eggs in one exam basketIn India's smaller cities, the chase for success is evolving from single-track dreams to multi-path strategies.

When Dhankhar got Salman Khan bail in blackbuck caseJagdeep Dhankhar resigned from the Vice-President's post, citing his health. Before becoming the Veep, Dhankhar was a seasoned lawyer who also represented actor Salman Khan in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case and helped him and other accused secure bail.

After harassment claims, Tanushree Dutta says she is leading quiet, spiritual lifeActor Tanushree Dutta stated that she was overwhelmed with constant media requests for interviews. She had recently claimed about facing life threat at her home in Mumbai.

Shruti Haasan promises a brave new world as father Kamal Haasan joins Rajya SabhaActor Kamal Haasan was sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP in Delhi. His actor-daughter Shruti Haasan dedicated an emotional post to him, highlighting the personal side of his political milestone.

sports.headline: 4th Test: Wheels come off for India in Manchester as Joe Root rewrites recordsEngland vs India, 4th Test: India conceded 319 runs as England seized control on Day 3 in Manchester. Joe Root scored a commanding 150, climbing to second place on the all-time list of Test run-scorers and leading what could be a series-defining batting charge for the hosts.

Manchester Test: India concede 500 overseas for the first time in 10 yearsThe Indian bowlers were made to toil on Day 3 of the Manchester Test as they conceded 500 runs. This was the first time in 10 years that India conceded 500-plus in an innings in an overseas Test.

Bengaluru stadium, set to host Women's World Cup matches, deemed unsafe: ReportThe M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been declared unsafe for large-scale events following a judicial commission report. The iconic venue is slated to host crucial matches in the upcoming Women's World Cup, scheduled for September-October.

China Open: Satwik-Chirag storm into semis, Unnati Hooda's dream run endsSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty advanced to the China Open semifinals with a win over Malaysia. Young Indian player Unnati Hooda's impressive run ended after losing to world number four Akane Yamaguchi.

Squash: Teenager Anahat Singh clinches bronze at World Junior ChampionshipsTeen squash sensation Anahat Singh secured a bronze medal at the World Squash Junior Championships. She became the first Indian girl since 2010 to reach the last-four stage in the tournament.

Joe Root goes past Ponting, only behind Tendulkar in all-time Test listJoe Root moved to second place in the all-time Test run-scorers list during the Manchester Test. His achievement highlights his consistency and raises expectations of surpassing Sachin Tendulkar.

Is captain Shubman Gill to blame for India's bowling flop show? Experts dividedEngland dominated India on Day 3 of the fourth Test at Old Trafford, exposing weaknesses in India's bowling attack. Questions arise over Shubman Gill's captaincy and the team's reluctance to use key spinners early in the innings.

Khalid Jamil emerges as frontrunner for Indian football team coach roleKhalid Jamil is the frontrunner for the vacant Indian men's football coach role. AIFF will announce the decision after an executive committee meeting within 10 days.

SA U-19 opener beats Vaibhav Suryavanshi to first-ever 200 in a Youth ODISouth Africa's Jorich van Schalkwyk beat Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be the first person to score a double hundred in a Youth ODI match.

India batter Veda Krishnamurthy announces retirement from professional cricketIndia batter Veda Krishnamurthy announced her retirement from professional cricket on Friday, July 25. Krishnamurthy was known for her explosive batting in the middle-order and was part of India's 2017 World Cup squad.

Shaheen Afridi makes T20I return as Pakistan announce West Indies tour squadsShaheen Shah Afridi has made a return to the T20I side as Pakistan announced their squads for the upcoming tour of the West Indies. Pakistan will play 3 ODIs and 3 T20Is against West Indies, starting on July 31.

Is captain Shubman Gill to blame for India's bowling flop show? Experts dividedEngland dominated India on Day 3 of the fourth Test at Old Trafford, exposing weaknesses in India's bowling attack. Questions arise over Shubman Gill's captaincy and the team's reluctance to use key spinners early in the innings.

Khalid Jamil emerges as frontrunner for Indian football team coach roleKhalid Jamil is the frontrunner for the vacant Indian men's football coach role. AIFF will announce the decision after an executive committee meeting within 10 days.

SA U-19 opener beats Vaibhav Suryavanshi to first-ever 200 in a Youth ODISouth Africa's Jorich van Schalkwyk beat Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be the first person to score a double hundred in a Youth ODI match.

India batter Veda Krishnamurthy announces retirement from professional cricketIndia batter Veda Krishnamurthy announced her retirement from professional cricket on Friday, July 25. Krishnamurthy was known for her explosive batting in the middle-order and was part of India's 2017 World Cup squad.

Shaheen Afridi makes T20I return as Pakistan announce West Indies tour squadsShaheen Shah Afridi has made a return to the T20I side as Pakistan announced their squads for the upcoming tour of the West Indies. Pakistan will play 3 ODIs and 3 T20Is against West Indies, starting on July 31.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
